Posts.Content: sadie12 wrote: About a month ago I found a mass in my left breast.  I went right away the next day to see my primary doctor and he set up a mammogram and ultrasound as soon as possible.  He called me himself and said your not out of the woods yet I will set you up with a surgeon to get the mass removed.  Well, they called the next day and said I needed to go to another hospital because of my insurance.  That was all fine but I had to start all over and do the tests over again. I was told I would get a letter in the mail regarding my results in a few days.  When it came it said that the mass needed further testing.  I went back to the walk in clinic at the hospital yesterday and they told me I needed a mammogram guided biopsy.  Then the nurse says to me "this doesnt look good from the ultrasound it looks malignant" She then said I probably wouldnt get my biopsy until the end of august. I was almost in tears I had just been told that the mass was posibly malignant and now im being told it is slow growing and it will be ok to wait.  Honestly I was not only in shock but terrified. I went home and told family what was going on and I was definatly down and worried but everyone keeps telling me not to worry until I get the biopsy results.  Thats all fine but how can I not be worried and upset when I was told it didnt look good?  I am so tired of hearing that I just want someone that will listen to my fears and talk about how I am feeling and not be cut off and told not to worry.  I definatly have support but I also need to get out how I feel.  Honestly I am terrified about what happens next.  Im sorry I rambled but I just dont know which way to turn now or if I should be so worried, I just really need advice. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Totally terrified sadie12 jenn333

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2012 03:56AM sadie12 wrote: I agree with all of you believe me.  I have horrible insurance and am only able to go to 2 hospitals in the state of Iowa.  Not only that I have to be refered from one hospital to go to the other.  I know it sounds crazy but its called Iowa Care so its low income insurance.  I have called 3 times since i wrote this post and have not gotten anywhere but I did take everyones advice and was put on a cancellation list.  Honestly right now I dont even have an appointment yet.  I am on a waiting list even worse yet I dont even have a primary care doctor I am on a waiting list for that as well.  They make us jump through hoops because we have no where else to turn and they know we have no money to go anywhere else. Trust me I am so mad I have talked to a supervisor and thats when i was placed on a list so supposedly the next cancellation is mine but we will see.  I am trying not to think the worst thanks to all of you and your experienced advise. My mom passed away in 2005 of a stroke and my mother in law laughs at me when I tell her i am worried about this.  So really have no one else to talk to that will listen.  My next move is going to Mayo clinic in Mn.  and i will if i cant get anything done here.  I have cancer on my dads side of the family so the thought of cancer scares me to death.  Anyway, thanks for all of your advise and you will all know as soon as I do and yes I to pray everyday for it to be B9
Posts.Title: Totally terrified sadie12 jenn333

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2012 05:10PM sadie12 wrote: Well, they called yesterday about my appointement for my biopsy.  It is scheduled for Aug 30th at 7:30 am.  I had assumed that there was only one mass and that was the one they are doing the biopsy on.  Wrong, I guess that is what I get for assuming that the Dr would tell me if it was different.  I have another mass in the same breast and that is the one that they are worried about being malignant.  They also said it is much bigger than the other mass but again they are still making me wait a month to have it done.  Then also found out that the radiologist is doing the biopsy not a breast surgeon.  I am more scared now than when I only thought there was one.  I am now trying to get a referal to University of Iowa Hospitals to see if I can see a breast surgeon there.  I am going to try Komen to see if they can help me get this done sooner.  Thanks again for all the help and support it helps to talk to all of you that have been through this before.
Posts.Title: Totally terrified sadie12 jenn333

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2012 03:57PM sadie12 wrote: Thank you all for the kind words and support.  I love my family and friends dearly but they just dont understand what I am going through right now.  I am definatly going to bug the hostpital until I can hopefully get in sooner. Right now unfortunatly I am still worried that it will be malignant. Thank you again I am so glad I found this site.
Posts.Title: Totally terrified sadie12 jenn333
